content.description: Pretty sustained technical vertical Climb. Great challenge if its the top of your grade. most likely not gonna fall but takes a while to get to the top.
content.location: This is the longer route in the alcove just past the slot canyon.

content.description: nice easy route. starts out climbing up slabby block-like features. crux is maybe 15'off the ground where the footing gets a little sparse and the holds aren't quite jugs.
content.location: left side of the alcove. this is the left of two five nines. also its two routes left of super fun

content.description:
Climb into the mildly choosy groove then head right as desired to the lovely bullet grey rock and enjoy one excellent crimp after another.

The start isn't perfect but the climb shines once you get into the grey.

This is called "Unknown 11c" in the Goss guide, but he has this route reversed with the next one to the right.
content.location:
To the left of the "Fun" routes in the Alcove is a bulging grey pillar.

This route begins well below a tan roof in a weird sort of groove/hueco series.

content.description:
Pull over a small, awkward roof and use clever crimps and sidepulls to follow the beautiful seam up the clean face.

The fun isn't over once you reach the rest ledge- enjoy the pockets between you and the anchors.
content.location:
This route climbs the grey pillar left of the "Fun" alcove.

Start between two small trees, belaying pretty much right in the middle of the path.

15-20 feet right of "Unknown weird groove

content.description:
Climb up the left side of the cave, then make some difficult moves getting established up on the face.

Edging up the grey face has it's own puzzles to solve...
content.location:
Between the Abyss gulley and the Alcove is a grey pillar with a large (human-size) cave about 15 feet up.

This route starts up the mini-arete on the left side of the cave.

content.description: Follow a series of crimps and edges up beautiful grey rock.
content.location: This route starts between the Abyss gulley and the Alcove. It is to the right of the big cave.

content.description: climbs through some almost vertical stemming and slab. then goes a little less vertical but no more stemming.
content.location: Left of the center of the alcove. also the first route to the left of super fun. this is the right of 2 5.9's on the left side of the alcove.

content.description: the start is a little harder than it looks and is a little scary feeling. goes up sustained mid 11 climbing up to a slightly steeper and hard to read crux. then up to the chains. great line!
content.protection: 14 draws to chain anchors with anchor hooks
content.location: just to the right of the alcove. first line to the right of super fun.
